title.narrative: IFC Global Emerging Markets Fund of Funds

description.narrative: The project entails an IFC equity investment of up to $150 million in the IFC Global Emerging Markets Fund of Funds (GEM Fund or the Fund). The Fund will seek to raise $750 million to $1 billion to invest in a diversified portfolio of private equity funds in the emerging market space.

The proposed Fund is expected to have significant developmental impact by supporting a minimum of 20-25 private equity and venture capital funds which will: (i) Support private sector development: investee funds will help to improve local companies'' competitiveness by providing equity capital and management advice; (ii) Stimulate economic growth and job creation: investee funds will invest in high-growth companies that will create new employment opportunities and contribute to economic development and employment; (iii) Promote international best governance practices: investee funds will be required to adhere to IFC''s ESG requirements and implement these at their investee companies. By mobilizing third-party institutional capital, the Fund will allow IFC to leverage its existing resources and thus expand its developmental impact. In addition, the Fund will help to deepen private equity markets by being able to provide liquidity to investors via secondary purchases, which will improve the attractiveness of the asset class as it provides for an alternative exit mechanism.
